results.title: Foundations of mathematics
results.creator_credit: Steve Campus and Steve Campus Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to show teachers working in the area of infant mathematics possible ways of using concrete equipment with an emphasis on formal pre-number work. Covers classifying and grouping; pattern; counting; equivalence; estimation; measurement; and shape. Suitable for lower primary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Found on a farm
results.brief_description: Depicts the adventures of four children during their visit to a farm. Their activities include fishing, looking at farm animals, and having a picnic in a shelter of straw bales. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Found
results.brief_description: This film effectively communicates a story as well as the emotions behind it with little reliance on dialogue. Annabelle explains the film ‘ A girl longs for connection with her absent father. A chance encounter brings new hope’ This film won the ACMI award for original sound in diegesis 2002.

results.title: Foto: Sven Nykvist
results.creator_credit: Bayley Silleck, Philip Strick and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description: This film explores the life and work of cinematographer, Sven Nykvist. Emphasises his style of lighting and sense of humanity through interviews and film clips from key Bergman and Nykvist productions. Features Liv Ullman and Erland Josephson.

results.title: Foster & Allen's Christmas collection
results.creator_credit: Bob Shipley, Quality Records and CMR Records
results.brief_description: Foster & Allen take us on a musical tour of Christmas with a selection of songs and carols. Interspersed with famous carols such as “We wish you a Merry Christmas”, “Jingle Bells”, “Rudolph the red-nosed reindeer” and the classic “Silent Night”, is a selection of their own favourites such as “Christmas time in Ireland” and “Silver Bells.” Hosted by Canadian Boyd Kozak, viewers are transported into a winter wonderland.

results.title: Foster's release
results.creator_credit: Terence Winkless, Milton C. Hubatka and Verexal Productions
results.brief_description: A suspenseful drama about a girl who, while babysitting, is the victim of anonymous telephone calls. She tries to have the calls traced. In the taut climax the telephone company and the police work feverishly to reach the girl in time to avert a tragedy. Combines atmospheric music and good use of camera shots including long shots, overhead and close-ups.

results.title: Fossils: clues to the past
results.creator_credit: Willis Briley, Thomas Craven, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Discusses what a fossil is, the ways in which fossils may be formed, what a fossil can tell us and how scientists determine their age. Shows a dig in Montana, USA, and the fossils being discovered.

results.title: Fossils: clues to prehistoric times
results.brief_description: This film explains where fossils are found, how they are formed and what clues they offer about the development of life. Uses museum dioramas, animation and many fossil specimens to explain the work and findings of scientists.

results.title: Forward a century
results.creator_credit: J.B. Napier-Bell, Stuart Legg and Basic Films
results.brief_description: A film made for the Festival of Britain surveying the nation’s achievements during the past 100 years, a note on contemporary conditions, and some indication of possible advances within the next 100 years. Old prints and engravings of life in Victorian ships, financial exchanges and Parliament, customs of the different classes, slums and other manifestations of poverty, all seen against a commentary explaining features of the period’s social, industrial, scientific and political history. Changes since that time illustrated by views of the 1951 Festival and of accomplishments in various technological fields, with emphasis on the increasing concern for human welfare. A number of scientists suggest possible sources of energy and power in 2051.

results.title: Forty thousand horsemen
results.creator_credit: Charles Chauvel and Famous Feature Films
results.brief_description: Forty thousand horsemen is set during World War 1 and deals with the exploits of the Australian Light Horse in Palestine. Chauvel’s uncle, who led the actual charge at Beersheba, was the inspiration for this acclaimed historical recreation. The film is unapologetically intensly nationalistic, viewed through the eyes of three Anzacs, Red (Grant Taylor), Larry (Pat Twohill) and Jim (Chips Rafferty). This internationally successful film established Chips Rafferty’s laconic bushman stereotype for which he became renown and established Chauvel as a world class director.
